author: Joe Smith
title: Behind Jesper Wallstedt‚Äôs path to his first NHL call-up with the Wild: ‚ÄòHe‚Äôs checked all the boxes‚Äô
text:
The morning after Jesper Wallstedt led the Iowa Wild to their first win of the season, his goalie coach Richard Bachman showed up to the rink in Manitoba thinking he‚Äôd have to give the touted prospect a pep talk.
Wallstedt, 21, had struggled a little bit with his conditioning in his first year of pro hockey, one of his biggest adjustments in moving over from Sweden. And he wasn‚Äôt scheduled to start that second game in a back-to-back, with
Zane McIntyre in net on this late October evening. It would have been easy for Wallstedt, coming off a 33-save performance, to make it more of a casual morning ‚Äî get his work in, attend meetings. You know the drill.
Advertisement
But when Bachman met up with Wallstedt, he got peppered with questions about the night before. The young goaltender went right to work. He was dialed in, self-motivated.
‚ÄúThat was a big, maturing step for him,‚Äù Bachman said. ‚ÄúJust wanting to get better every single day so he can make it up to the
NHL as quick as possible. It was one of those moments where it kind of clicks. You see it in the NHL all the time. There are no off days. He wants to put in the extra work at all times so he can become a very good NHL goalie, the kind of goalie everyone expects him to be.‚Äù
Wallstedt‚Äôs first taste of the NHL is coming soon, as the 6-foot-3 Swede was called up Sunday by the
Wild. He could make his much-anticipated first start Wednesday in Dallas against the Stars; coach John Hynes said Marc-Andre Fleury is starting Monday. The Wild planned to take their time with Wallstedt, the No. 20 pick in 2021, and he said he‚Äôs much more comfortable and confident in his second year of pro.
Coach Brett McLean said the final test for any player before a call-up is having success in the AHL, and Wallstedt has been their best player. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs checked all the boxes,‚Äù McLean said. ‚ÄúIt certainly looks like he‚Äôs ready to take on some games in the National Hockey League.‚Äù
While Wallstedt‚Äôs stay is expected to be short, until
Filip Gustavsson returns from injury, he sees the big picture for where he‚Äôll eventually fit.
‚ÄúI want to prove that I can not only practice at this level but play games at this level,‚Äù Wallstedt told The Athletic earlier this season. ‚ÄúI feel like I‚Äôve done that so far, but it‚Äôs about keeping it going. I‚Äôm the one that, sooner than later, wants to get here. I want to be here full time and every day. But I want to keep developing and build something that‚Äôs going to be working for a long while. It‚Äôs better to have one or two more years in the AHL and build something that can hold for 10-15 in the NHL, as opposed to getting there this year, being able to play for 3-4 years and not hold anymore.‚Äù
GO DEEPER
Jesper Wallstedt unmasked: Meet the Wild's future No. 1 goalie ‚Äî 'their ace in the hole'
Wallstedt knows he certainly wouldn‚Äôt have been ready last season. It was his first season as a pro in North America, and despite all of his accolades and pedigree, Wallstedt struggled a bit early on before becoming an All-Star caliber player in the league.
Advertisement
‚ÄúI think it was more difficult than I thought,‚Äù Wallstedt said. ‚ÄúI thought I had a lot of experience playing against older men and in a men‚Äôs league. I came from the SHL, which is a great league, but the AHL is definitely a challenging league. Tough competition and a lot of great players. It was tough in the beginning. I felt good but not great. I‚Äôm still adjusting to everything over here, being so far away from home.‚Äù
Wallstedt grew up in Vasteras, Sweden, which is an hour outside Stockholm. His father was his first goalie coach until he was 12. His brother is still his best friend. But Wallstedt has gone 7-8 months in his first two seasons between seeing his family. As much as Wallstedt‚Äôs adjustments on the ice took time ‚Äî like how to handle shots coming from corners on the larger surface ‚Äî he had to find the right comfort zone away from the rink.
Wallstedt and teammate Simon Johansson became close, doing a lot of things together. Ryan O‚ÄôRourke became a good friend too, inviting them over to his house for dinners or to watch the Wild or NHL games.
Wallstedt also got a car, an Audi, which has helped give him more independence.
‚ÄúI remember in the beginning always trying to catch a ride with anyone,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAs soon as they went to the grocery store, I had to follow. You get a car, you can do everything by yourself. That‚Äôs a stress factor that was a huge factor for me. I felt like I was so stuck into having to ask everyone for help. Everyone was so helpful, which was great. But it was tough always having to need someone to help me.‚Äù
The main thing Bachman and the Iowa staff have worked on with Wallstedt is his conditioning, which is dramatically better this season than last year. Wallstedt himself called it an eye-opener, which gave him a better idea of how to train this past summer (three days a week conditioning, three days working on strength, plus on ice).
Advertisement
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a huge difference ‚Äî night and day,‚Äù Wallstedt said. ‚ÄúI feel like the first three practices in camp were really tough for everyone. But I felt I could stay in there and hang for much longer.‚Äù
‚ÄúHe‚Äôs turned into a man now,‚Äù Bachman said. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs big and strong. Sometimes, you look at last year, he still had good power. He‚Äôs got long legs, you can push hard. But where you really started to notice it last year, you get halfway or so through practice and you start to lose some of the technique, his ability to keep fighting through it and get all the way to the end of practice. From day one this year, it has not been an issue at all. He‚Äôs got great energy, and he‚Äôs given us a chance pretty much every night.‚Äù
Fresh off his 20th birthday and 1st goalie goal in
[#mnwild]organization history, Iowa‚Äôs Jesper Wallstedt joins my pod to discuss the exciting moment, transitioning to USA, unretiring No. 1, accountability, his NHL development plan, Lundqvist, Fleury & more
‚Äî Michael Russo (@RussoHockey)
[November 15, 2022]
What‚Äôs struck Bachman and McLean about Wallstedt is his hockey sense; how he reads the game, the play in front of him. It‚Äôs not necessarily about watching a ton of video, but keeping a computer in his brain of all his experiences.
‚ÄúI‚Äôm ahead in my head all the time,‚Äù Wallstedt said. ‚ÄúI read the game so well, that all the plays happening never surprise me. I see what‚Äôs going to happen before it happens. But I‚Äôve got to be able to execute it every time and fast enough. It‚Äôs up to me to make the save. I feel now I‚Äôm in better position to have the odds on my side for every save.‚Äù
Wallstedt has been able to be more consistent this season, including rattling off a five-game winning streak from late October to early November and then winning three in a row in early December. He has a 2.54 goals-against average and .917 save percentage over 20 games. To be a starter at the AHL level, much less the NHL, it‚Äôs about handling the good times as well as the bad, and Wallstedt has been willing to put in the work between starts to make adjustments.
‚ÄúI think he‚Äôs learned a lot just by playing games,‚Äù Bachman said. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs learned how the game works here in North America. With any young goalie, it‚Äôs about reps and situations and learning to read plays and he has an unbelievable hockey IQ. And so now he‚Äôs taking all that information that when you get up to the NHL, he can just apply there and doesn‚Äôt have to learn it up there on the fly. He‚Äôs already putting the time in here for that. But I think the biggest area for him that will give him success up there is he has a plan not only at the rink on how he prepares and practices and plays. He learned to really take care of himself.‚Äù
It‚Äôs been a hectic season for Iowa, especially with all the injuries to the Wild. A good chunk of the forward group has been called up, with at one point their top four scorers up with the big club. Their captain,
Dakota Mermis, has been with Minnesota for most of the season. And that‚Äôs where having Wallstedt‚Äôs presence in net has helped provide some confidence to the group.
Advertisement
‚ÄúEverybody says it‚Äôs a kind of calmness in-game, which is very impressive,‚Äù McLean said. ‚ÄúWhen you see that up close, each and every day, we‚Äôre having a tough shift in our end, and he‚Äôs getting a few shots and there‚Äôs some pressure and he‚Äôll just calmly put his glove hand over the puck and freeze the puck and get a whistle. He never panics in those situations.‚Äù
‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a very, very good goalie,‚Äù said Jacob Lucchini, Wallstedt‚Äôs teammate in Iowa, now with the Wild. ‚ÄúI tell people, he never makes massive saves, he‚Äôs just always in the right spot. He‚Äôs been outstanding. Just so steady. Doesn‚Äôt give up much.‚Äù
Another thing McLean has noticed is how Wallstedt has become ‚Äúpart of the fabric‚Äù of the team. He‚Äôs showing his personality more, jumping into the banter during and after practices. It‚Äôs helped him take more of a leadership role, too. Lucchini said Wallstedt is always smiling ‚Äî a ‚Äúgoofy,‚Äù down-to-earth kind of teammate. ‚ÄúWhen guys are dishing it out, he‚Äôs dishing it back,‚Äù McLean said. ‚ÄúSometimes with goalies, especially young ones, they just keep to themselves and stick to their own routine. But not him. He‚Äôs right in there with the entire group and not intimidated by any player or any person. He‚Äôs a really important part of our team, not just on the ice, but off.‚Äù
An example McLean used was a recent practice in which Wallstedt‚Äôs teammates were ‚Äúhooting and hollering‚Äù after scoring several goals on him. Wallstedt gave it back to them, showing some flair with a few of his saves, including flipping the puck into his glove, reminiscent of Fleury.
‚ÄúVery much a ‚ÄòFlower‚Äô type thing,‚Äù McLean said.
Wallstedt said he‚Äôs learned a lot while in camp with Fleury and Gustavsson. Part of that is just watching them practice and compete and watching how they train. The plan all along, if things work out well, is for Wallstedt to potentially join Gustavsson in a tandem in net next season; Fleury is in the final year of his contract. Wallstedt has been on board with the team being patient and wanting him to get as much seasoning as possible in the AHL before making the jump.
‚ÄúThe whole organization has set it up for success for myself,‚Äù Wallstedt said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve had a great team around me since day one, since I‚Äôve been in the organization. They‚Äôve put a lot of resources and their time into my development, which is amazing. I feel like we‚Äôre going in the right direction and continuing to just improve.

‚ÄúWhen I‚Äôm ready, I‚Äôm ready.‚Äù

title: Atividades para aproveitar o anivers√°rio de S√£o Paulo
text:
A cidade de S√£o Paulo celebra 471 anos neste s√°bado (25). Como de praxe, no caldeir√£o cultural desta metr√≥pole n√£o faltam atra√ß√µes para aproveitar a data. author: (Dassaev T√©llez Adame)
title: #ColumnaInvitada | El dominio territorial del crimen organizado no es casualidad
text:
Las declaraciones recientes de Salvador Rangel, obispo em√©rito de Chilpancingo-Chilapa, sobre la cooptaci√≥n de la clase pol√≠tica guerrerense por parte de grupos criminales y las negociaciones que l√≠deres religiosos promovieron entre dichas organizaciones para alcanzar una pax narca en Chilpancingo, arrojan un diagn√≥stico fat√≠dico sobre la salud de nuestra democracia: los grupos criminales mandan en los territorios.
Publicidad Lee m√°s voces #ColumnaInvitada | El plan de seguridad del INE y sus fallas de origen Esta realidad no es exclusiva de Guerrero. El crimen domina territorios en Zacatecas, Jalisco, Chiapas, Michoac√°n y otras entidades y no se trata de ninguna casualidad. En los √∫ltimos a√±os, los grupos criminales desarrollaron capacidades en aspectos clave para su fortalecimiento organizacional y pol√≠tico en las que el Estado mexicano en cambio parece haber claudicado. Particularmente en tres rubros: i) capacidad operativa, ii) profesionalizaci√≥n, y iii) voluntad y acci√≥n pol√≠tica.
Capacidad operativa
Mientras que las corporaciones policiales de muchos municipios carecen de elementos suficientes y equipamiento b√°sico como armamento o patrullas, los grupos criminales engrosan sus filas a paso veloz y constantemente diversifican sus herramientas. No s√≥lo cuentan con equipo t√°ctico profesional y armas de alto calibre, ahora tambi√©n emplean dispositivos dignos de milicias especializadas como minas terrestres y drones con bombas e incluso operan sus propios centros de monitoreo con c√°maras de videovigilancia. Son mucho m√°s eficaces en el uso de la violencia que las fuerzas del Estado.
Por esto es muy complicado que polic√≠as locales e incluso militares ofrezcan alguna clase de resistencia frente al avance territorial del crimen. Al respecto, de acuerdo con Causa en Com√∫n, de 2018 a 2023 incrementaron notablemente los asesinatos de polic√≠as debido a la violencia del crimen organizado en entidades como Colima (142.9%), Michoac√°n (75%) o Zacatecas (255%) y en otras como Jalisco o Guerrero no paran los asesinatos de funcionarios y pol√≠ticos.
Lee m√°s voces #ColumnaInvitada | SOS por la democracia mexicana
Profesionalizaci√≥n
Hay pol√≠ticos y funcionarios p√∫blicos muy destacados en todos los niveles de gobierno y filiaciones partidistas, pero tambi√©n abundan ejemplos de incompetencia gubernamental con costos sociales y econ√≥micos alt√≠simos; un tramo de la l√≠nea 12 del Metro de la Ciudad de M√©xico se desplom√≥, migrantes murieron en instalaciones del gobierno y hace unos d√≠as el sistema del SAT se cay√≥ paralizando las operaciones aduaneras. Tambi√©n persisten factores asociados fuertemente con la impunidad, como la debilidad institucional de polic√≠as y fiscal√≠as o la profundizaci√≥n de la militarizaci√≥n de la vida p√∫blica. La profesionalizaci√≥n de la administraci√≥n p√∫blica no vive su mejor momento.
En contraste, los grupos criminales cada vez son m√°s implacables; aprovechan con eficacia fen√≥menos econ√≥micos y las tecnolog√≠as de la informaci√≥n para maximizar o diversificar sus actividades (es muy posible que el nearshoring est√© vinculado con el incremento del robo a transportista en el √∫ltimo a√±o), explotan mecanismos pol√≠ticamente correctos para lavar dinero como las remesas, instalan y operan eficazmente laboratorios para producir drogas sint√©ticas y proceden bajo l√≥gicas completamente empresariales para mitigar riesgos como cuando salen a deslindarse de actos de violencia de alto impacto. Es claro que entre las filas de los grupos criminales hay m√°s que sicarios. El avance territorial del crimen no puede explicarse sin la participaci√≥n de personal altamente capacitado que sabe identificar y aprovechar los vac√≠os que deja la debilidad institucional del Estado.
Publicidad Lo √∫ltimo #ZonaLibre | No se trata de ellos #El Personaje | El negro historial de Sergio Estrada Cajigal Ram√≠rez El Circo üé™| Trabalenguas del Domador, show desbalanceado y naranjas atorados Publicidad Voluntad y acci√≥n pol√≠tica
El obispo em√©rito Salvador Rangel afirm√≥ con Carlos Loret de Mola que los l√≠deres de Los Tlacos y Los Ardillos acordaron t√©rminos de paz. Hablamos de dos grupos criminales guerrerenses que llevan a√±os disputando de forma muy violenta el control de las econom√≠as locales, principalmente en Chilpancingo, y que no obstante lograron un consenso (la Familia Michoacana vinculada con la matanza en San Miguel Totolapan hace unos d√≠as est√° fuera de esta ecuaci√≥n).
Lee m√°s voces #ColumnaInvitada | Los sexenios terminan y el feminicidio prevalece El mensaje es claro: actores criminales cuentan con mayor voluntad y acci√≥n pol√≠tica que el Estado mexicano, pues muestran capacidad para escuchar a representantes de las comunidades y construir arreglos informales con efectos directos sobre la gobernabilidad de los territorios y consolidar su dominio sobre los mismos. En cambio, los gobiernos oficialistas, particularmente el ejecutivo federal, destacan por negar los grandes problemas nacionales, cerrar los canales de comunicaci√≥n y polarizar a la sociedad. Es uno de los peores escenarios posibles pues la seguridad depende de la autoridad criminal.
El camino para contrarrestar el control territorial de los grupos criminales es claro, aunque no sencillo de recorrer pues implica: i) incrementar la capacidad operativa de polic√≠as y fiscal√≠as locales, ii) impulsar la profesionalizaci√≥n de servidores p√∫blicos en todos los niveles y √°mbitos de gobierno, y iii) abrir canales permanentes de di√°logo con todas las fuerzas pol√≠ticas y actores sociales para establecer mecanismos alternativos de pacificaci√≥n bajo la tutela del Estado. Al d√≠a de hoy los grupos criminales no tienen ning√∫n incentivo para detener su avance. Estamos cerca del punto de no retorno. Claudia Sheinbaum o X√≥chitl G√°lvez cuentan con suficiente informaci√≥n para evitarlo. ¬øTendr√°n la voluntad de hacerlo?
____
Nota del editor: Armando Vargas (@BaVargash) es Doctor en Ciencia Pol√≠tica, profesor universitario y consultor especializado en (in)seguridad p√∫blica y riesgo pol√≠tico en Integralia Consultores (@Integralia_Mx). Las opiniones publicadas en esta columna corresponden exclusivamente al autor.

author: Tim Newcomb
title: Gray Hair May Be Reversible, New Study Says
text:
Study links graying hair to stem cells getting stuck, unable to color new hair growth. Stem cells travel back and forth within compartments, but when they get stuck in one compartment, they cannot regenerate into pigment cells. Restoring mobility of the cells could allow the continuation of pigment production, eliminating graying hair. Advertisement If only our pesky stem cells didn‚Äôt get stuck in place after a while, maybe we wouldn‚Äôt have gray hair. Really. Thanks to a new study published in the journal Nature and led by researchers from New York University‚Äôs Grossman School of Medicine, the team revealed how stuck melanocyte stem cells (McSCs) can‚Äôt make the protein needed to pigment hair, potentially explaining gray hair.
Using mice as the research subjects, the team found that McSCs travel between compartments of developing hair follicles in a healthy situation. The differing compartments allow the McSCs to mature and pick up the protein that can regenerate into pigment cells and continually color hair as it grows. These McSCs shift back and forth between maturity levels over time as they continually move between the compartments, a unique aspect of the McSCs.
But in some cases, the McSCs can get stuck in the hair follicle bulge compartment and become unable to move back to the germ compartment, where the WNT proteins encourage the cells to regenerate into pigment cells. Getting stuck means no pigment cells, which means gray hair.
‚ÄúIt is the loss of chameleon-like function in melanocyte stems cells that may be responsible for graying and loss of hair color,‚Äù Mayumi Ito, study senior investigator and professor in the Ronald O. Perelman Department of Dermatology and Department of Cell Biology at NYU Langone Health, says in a news release . ‚ÄúThese findings suggest that melanocyte stem cell motility and reversible differentiation are key to keeping hair healthy and colored.‚Äù
Basically, if the McSCs can keep moving‚Äîor, if they get stuck, we can somehow prod them to get going again‚Äîwe should expect more colorful heads of hair the world over.
‚ÄúOur study adds to our basic understanding of how melanocyte stem cells work to color hair,‚Äù Qi Sun, postdoctoral fellow at NYU Langone Health, says in a news release . ‚ÄúThe newfound mechanisms raise the possibility that the same fixed positioning of melanocyte stem cells may exist in humans. If so, it presents a potential pathway for reversing or preventing the graying of human hair by helping jammed cells to move again between developing hair follicle compartments.‚Äù
The McSCs focus on pigment-making, and are different from cells responsible for hair growth, Sun says, so hair can to continue growing even without pigment. The NYU study showed that as the hair regrowth process aged, the number of McSC‚Äôs lodged in the follicle bulge continued to increase. At some points, this non-pigment producing follicle bulge contains roughly 50 percent of all McSCs.
The McSCs that remained mobile retained their ability to produce pigment, but with the ever-shifting requirements of McSCs breaking down over time, the rise of gray hair coincided with aging. And while stress has also been associated with graying hair, unrelated Harvard research says that stress simply increases the hair regrowth pattern, speeding up the aging process for hair follicles.
‚ÄúFor unknown reasons, the melanocyte stem cell system fails earlier than other adult stem cell populations, which leads to hair graying in most humans and mice,‚Äù according to the NYU study.
The next step for the NYU team involves looking at how we can get McSCs, once stuck, moving again. Because once they move, they create pigment. And that could mean the end of gray.

Esto fue grabado en Acarigua, Venezuela, por Wil Romero‚Äù, cont√≥. ‚ÄúUn equipo maravilloso de chicos que no vivieron mi fen√≥meno, pero que ustedes van a ver el videazo que nos tiramos‚Äù, agreg√≥ la artista. Karina igualmente resalt√≥ en la citada red social lo mucho que disfruta al trabajar con gente m√°s joven que ella. ‚ÄúPara m√≠ es un privilegio trabajar con otras generaciones y es un privilegio seguir haciendo lo que hago con esta ilusi√≥n que tengo. La tambi√©n actriz, que inici√≥ el a√±o afectada por una gripe, coment√≥ tambi√©n que pronto anunciar√° lo que se viene para ella. ‚ÄúVoy a estar inactiva un poco este mes de enero, tengo cosas personales de las que me tengo que ocupar, por supuesto, pero voy a seguir trabajando en crear lo que viene, porque este a√±o viene fuerte, grande, pr√≥spero‚Ä¶ Pero para todo eso, la salud primero‚Äù, manifest√≥. author: Zhi Hao
title: Chinese Woman Sells Sons for S$15,800 to Tip Livestream Hosts, Gets 5-Year Sentence
text:
A 26-year-old Chinese woman has been sentenced to five years and two months in prison after selling her two biological sons to fund her extravagant lifestyle and tip livestream hosts.
Huang, originally from Guangxi province in southern China, was found guilty of fraud and trafficking by the Fuzhou Jin‚Äôan District People‚Äôs Court on 8 Jul 2025. The court also imposed a fine of 30,000 yuan (~SGD$5,700) on her.
The case has sparked widespread public outrage across China, with many calling her sentence too lenient for abandoning two children.
Mother‚Äôs Background and First Child Sale
Huang, who received only primary school education, was adopted as a child herself. Due to lack of education and care from her adoptive parents, she left home at an early age.
She later moved to Fuzhou, Fujian province in southeastern China, where she made a living doing odd jobs and part-time work.
In October 2020, Huang gave birth to her first son. Struggling financially and without support from the baby‚Äôs father, she decided to sell the child.
Her landlord, surnamed Wei, learned of her plan and introduced her to a relative, surnamed Li, whose son was infertile and had long wished to adopt a child. Li‚Äôs family purchased the baby boy for 45,000 yuan (~SGD$8,600).
Huang spent the entire amount tipping livestreaming anchors and buying fancy clothes for herself.
Click here!
Deliberate Conception and Second Child Sale
When she ran out of money, Huang resorted to extreme measures. She actively sought out men for sex, intent on conceiving another child to sell purely for profit.
Read Also: JJ Lin Clutches His Stomach in Apparent Pain During Concert, Reveals He Has Heart Condition
In 2022, Huang gave birth to a second son named Guyu. She sold him to a broker for 38,000 yuan (~SGD$7,200), who then resold the baby for 103,000 yuan (~SGD$19,600).
Huang reportedly spent all the money on tips for live-streamers, buying clothes and other extravagant items with the proceeds.
On 13 Apr 2022, Huang was reported to the authorities for suspected fraud. A police investigation uncovered chat records on her mobile phone related to the sale of children.
Both boys were rescued by the police in April 2022 and have been placed under the care of local civil affairs departments, awaiting adoption.
Legal Consequences and Public Reaction
Li was sentenced to nine months in prison, suspended for one year, for purchasing a trafficked child. Wei received a seven-month prison term for his role in facilitating the first sale.
The case, reported by state media CCTV, has sparked widespread online outrage across China.
One online observer said: ‚ÄúIs this even real news from the human world? Only five years for abandoning two children? That is way too lenient.‚Äù
Another commented: ‚ÄúNo sympathy. She should be sentenced to 30 years to reflect her crimes properly.‚Äù
A third person said: ‚ÄúShe is a monster and is not fit to be a mother.‚Äù
Human trafficking in China has a long and complex history. A market for the sale of people has existed for decades and is often facilitated by families. The illegal adoption, especially of boys, was seen as essential for continuing the family lineage and enhancing family status.
